column4: I have like 3 floppy disks I can use.. how do I install ubuntu?
no one knows how to do it?
that is a serious problem if you guys require cds...
I have a wireless laptop on the same network with fbsd
basically I ran out of cd-r's
I have a cd-rw, but it fails to load vmlinuz
can I burn the iso on a dvd-r?
or for warty, better try this one first: http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/warty/main/installer-i386/release/images/netboot/
I think that would work, but I think you should better setup a tftp server and do a network installation
http://d-i.alioth.debian.org/manual/en.i386/ch04s06.html, and the rest of the manual
ubuntu is using debian installer, so the documentation applies mostly for ubuntu too
if your network card's having problems with netbooting, create a floppy for it at http://rom-o-matic.org
ah that is a good idea, the dhcp server is a router, so it can't run tftp though
